text: Renowned thin Koloocheh from Fuman, Iran prior to cooking Koloocheh (Persian: کلوچه) is a Persian cookie made in various parts of Iran. Koloochehs from southern Iran are brittle biscuits that principally consists of water, sugar, wheat flour and egg white. Koloocheh are souvenirs of Shiraz. ==References== ==See also== *Kleicha * Kolompeh *Ma'amoul Category:Cookies Category:Shiraz Category:Iranian pastries Category:Talysh cuisine
title: Koloocheh
